meta.title: School Closure - Stoughton Area School District

li.a: Virtual Learning Student Characteristics for Success
Stoughton Community Group Outdoor Facility Use
Annual Central Registration for Current Students

div.p: Contact our district office: Please leave a message at (608)877-5012. Calls will be returned within 48 business hours.

h5.strong: As of Thursday, April 16, SASD schools are closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. At this time, we will continue our 4K-12 virtual learning. Please continue checking your email and referring back to this webpage for updates.

p.strong: Read our most recent communication to families.

li.a: Problem with Schoology? Here's what to do
Do's and don'ts - Safer at Home, social distancing, travel
"I'm feeling sick. What do I do?"

div.p: Stoughton Schools are closed but continue to provide the opportunity for all of our children to receive free, nutritious meals. All children aged 18 and under, as well as students aged 19-21 who have not yet graduated, regardless of free & reduced meal status, are eligible.

In an effort to serve our students and support the current stay at home order, we deliver meals door-to-door to those that have signed up. We also provide meals for the weekend. This service will continue until school resumes.
Families currently using our meal pickup service from our four locations will be automatically included in the door-to-door meal delivery effective April 17.
Families not signed up but who would like to, please fill out this form. Please note:

ul.li: A separate form for each child is needed to ensure each meal is included in our daily count.

Please know that depending on when you submit the form in our delivery cycle, the first delivery date of your meals may vary. Within 24 business hours of your submission, you will receive a confirmation phone call to review the delivery protocol and confirm the first delivery date of your meals. If you do not receive a call within 24 business hours, please contact Jenny McKenna at jenny.mckenna@Stoughton.k12.wi.us or leave a message at (608)877-5012.
4K and EC families: When filling out the form, please select the elementary school you are assigned to based on your address.
Deliveries will be made on Monday, Wednesday and Friday between 11 a.m. and 12 p.m.
Monday delivery will include: lunch for Monday; breakfast and lunch for Tuesday; and breakfast for Wednesday.
Wednesday delivery will include: lunch for Wednesday; breakfast and lunch for Thursday; and breakfast for Friday.
Friday delivery will include: lunch for Friday; breakfast and lunch for Saturday; breakfast and lunch for Sunday; and breakfast for Monday.

div.p: If you have any questions or concerns, please contact Jenny McKenna at jenny.mckenna@Stoughton.k12.wi.us or leave a message at (608)877-5012.

p.b: SASD schools are closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. During school closure, the following conditions apply:

ul.li: Instruction will be virtual.
All district-sponsored events (concerts, performances, conferences, field trips, etc.) are cancelled.
All sports and other extracurricular practices and competitions are cancelled.
School buildings will be open to a select few of staff only.
All district facilities, including the pool, are closed for use by internal or external groups.

div.p: In the best interest of the health of our students and community, all out-of-state and abroad student trips are cancelled through the end of July, regardless of the school closure end date.

During this unprecedented health challenge, our SASD community remains committed to providing learning opportunities to all of our students. Since we became aware of the closure of our buildings, our instructional staff has been collaboratively innovating and designing virtual learning experiences for your child(ren). While our daily routines and instructional delivery will look very different from our usual pace, you will notice that our dedication, thoughtfulness, and concern for your student’s growth remains steadfast.

While we are focused on your child’s academic, social, and emotional growth, we are also remaining mindful that this is also a time of intense pressure for our community, state, and world. So, it is our hope that you will see that our student learning plans are attentive to the uniquenesses of our families and students across our grade levels, allowing for flexibility and options for students who may need more support, especially in this new environment.

Our learning structure has some differences between students in grades K-5, and those in grades 6-12. Students in grades 6-12 will access Schoology, as they did on March 19-20. Please find information and plans related to your child’s virtual learning experience in the following places:

ul.li:
Elementary: At grades K-5, each school will have a website, with tabs for plans specific to each grade level. Check your child’s school website; then go to your child’s grade level:
Fox Prairie Site
Kegonsa Site
Sandhill Site

River Bluff Middle School & Stoughton High School: Students in grades 6-12 will continue to use Schoology to manage their learning (as they did from March 19-20). Students can find information about activities, assignments and any instructional content at each course’s Schoology site. Students should continue to log in to the Schoology online learning platform each day.

div.p: As we move forward, we will be reaching out to families to learn more about your experiences with virtual learning, and how we can reflect and adjust to better meet needs.
As always, SASD is committed to serving our 4K and Early Childhood students and families, especially during this time.
4K: On Sunday, April 5, we launched our 4K virtual learning site. Click to view. We are so excited!
Early Childhood: We are providing activities for Early Childhood families to implement "at home school." Find our suggested activities in our 4K/EC newsletters.
April 21, 2020: In light of Governor Evers’ recent updates to the Safer at Home order, we will not be holding Summer Excel registration on Monday, April 27.

We are currently considering a variety of options for 2020 Summer Excel programming. Updates will be in family e-news and messaging when available. We will let you know ASAP when decisions have been made.
Thank you for your patience as work to determine the safest and best options for our students.

h2.a: Problem with Schoology? Here's what to do

div.p: Due to the increased demand of online applications from many districts, we are learning that service providers are experiencing issues on their end. At times, our learning management system, Schoology, has been intermittent at best. While this is largely out of the district’s control, we wanted to provide guidance when learning applications experience issues now and in the future.

When there is an outage, the district will send out a communication to staff, families and students. When services have been restored, the district will send a communication out to staff, families and students.

p.strong: Guidance for students during an outage:

li.p: Check your email for directions or next steps from your teacher.
Know that you will not receive a lowered grade due to late submissions when learning applications are down.
Know that you will not be marked absent as a result of an outage.

div.p: Google Drive disconnects was one of the issues that has impacted some users. If you are experiencing issues with your Google Drive within Schoology, please view this tutorial on how to reconnect.

p.b: Timeline for Schoology to be fixed during an outage

div.p: The unreliability of Schoology is not unique to Stoughton. All districts that have adopted Schoology as a learning management system are experiencing the same issues. Unfortunately, the district cannot address the issues we are experiencing and therefore cannot give a timeline of when it will be fixed. This is one reason why we have provided both students and staff guidance to reference in the event of an outage.

Technology Requests: By this time, most students should have received the necessary technology (hotspots and Chromebooks) to engage in virtual learning from home. If you still need to request technology, please contact your student's principal. (We are no longer using a Google Form.)
Technology Support Request via the internet: If your student experiences technology issues during their virtual learning, we are here to help. To submit a technology support request, click here.

Technology Support Request via phone: If you do not have access to the internet and are experiencing technology issues, you can call (608) 877-5056 to leave a detailed message describing the issue you are experiencing. A member of the technology team will follow up with you.

Chromebook Repairs: We will be open to exchange Chromebooks that are in need of repair by appointment only. After you complete the technology support form, you will be emailed instructions on how to make an appointment for repair.

Technology at K-5 level: K-5 virtual learning will start after spring break, on Monday, March 30. This start date allows both families and the district some time to continue working on technology assistance. At the K-5 level, virtual learning will likely be around 1-2 hours each day. However, not all of those 1-2 hours will be spent in front of a screen.

ul.li: Letter to families 3/27 from Keli Melcher, Director of Student Services

div.p: IEPs: The district will continue holding Annual IEPs during the closure as required by the Department of Education, the Office of Civil Rights, the Office of Special Education Programs, and the Department of Public Instruction. IEPs will be held either through video conference or phone conference during the school closure. When school resumes, we may hold review/revise meetings face-to-face as determined by IEP teams.

Evaluations: We will hold Evaluation meetings via video conference or phone conference if we have the information from testing that we need to make an eligibility decision. The teams will determine with you whether face-to-face evaluation is needed (delay the evaluation until school resumes) or whether testing can occur virtually (parental consent and move forward with virtual meeting).

Service Delivery: Due to the Governor's order of school closure and no face-to-face instruction, we will continue to provide access to the general education curriculum and special education services to our students in a virtual format. These services may look very different than they do when school is in session. The district is currently working on a process. In the upcoming weeks, we will communicate with you either through your case manager, principal or more generally through the district's webpage.
THANKS SO MUCH FOR YOUR PATIENCE! STAY WELL!

Our district nurse Laurel Gretebeck is committed to supporting our students and families. After spring break, she will be holding daily office hours via phone and email, as well as checking emails periodically during the school day.
Office hours: Weekdays from 9 to 11 a.m., starting Monday, March 30.
Contact information: Laurel.Gretebeck@Stoughton.K12.WI.US; (608) 352-9305
We are working on options for the best way to get medications to families. Please contact our district nurse Laurel Gretebeck if medications and health supplies are needed earlier.

ul.li: SAMHSA disaster distress hotline 1-800-985-5990 or text TalkWithUs to 66746 to connect with a trained crisis counselor.
National Suicide Prevention Lifeline: 1-800-273-8255

em.strong: This webpage was last updated 4/21/20 at 9:30 a.m.

li.a: School closed for remainder of school year 4/16/20
Orari ynë i ri i shkollës është

h2.a: Orari ynë i ri i shkollës është

p.b: Dua të filloj duke ju falënderuar për mbështetjen dhe fleksibilitetin tuaj gjatë këtyre kohërave vërtet të jashtëzakonshme. Sot po ju shkruaj me një mesash të ri shumë të pritur nga Guvernatori Evers.

Ne e dimë se ky komunikim nuk do ti përgjigjet të gjitha pyetjeve tuaja. Detajet të mëtutjeshme, përfshirë vendimit rreth aktiviteteve të verës, do të vijnë shpejt. Ne e vlerësojmë durimin tuaj deri sa lundrojmë gjatë mbylljes së shkollës së bashku.

Të Enjtën, 16 Prill, Sekretarja e Departamentit të Shërbimeve Shëndetësore të shetit Wisconsin ose “Secretary of the Wisconsin Department of Health Services” Andrea Palm, me udhëzimet nga Guvernori Evers, ka urdhëruar mbyllje ose “ordered the closure” e të gjitha shkollave publike dhe private K-12 për pjesën e mbetur të vitit shkollor 2019-2020. Ky njoftim gjithashtu zgjëroi urdhrin më të gjatë Më i/e Sigurt në Shtëpi ose “Safer at Home” për të përfunduar më 26 Maj.

Deri sa shumë prej nesh e kishim pritur këtë lajm të vijë, nuk ishte diqka që njëri nga ne dëshironim. Por unë kam besim se ne do të vazhdojmë të bashkohemi së bashku për ta bërë këtë punë . Ndër ato që mund të duken sikur vetëm disa rreshta, një rresht argjendi është se ne kemi bërë atë që duhet të bëjmë për tre javë tani. Ne do të vazhdojmë atë që kemi filluar me kreativitet, fleksibilitet dhe ndjeshmëri.
Në këtë kohë, ne do të vazhdojmë mësimet tona virtuale me studentët 4K-12 për pjesën e mbetur të vitit. Ju lutemi shikoni emailin tuaj së afërmi për qdo të reja dhe udhëzime të mësimeve virtuale.
Klasa e vitit 2020, ju lutemi dijeni që ne jemi këtu për ju. Më shumë informacione në lidhje me diplomimin dhe ngjarjet tjera do të vijnë më vonë

hr.p: Gjatë kohës së mbylljes së shkollës (16 Mars--), zbatohen kushtet e mëposhtme:

li.p: Të gjitha ngjarjet e sponzorizuara nga Qarku i shkollës (koncertet, shfaqjet, etj.) dhe shëtitjet jashtë shkollës janë anuluar.
Të gjitha sportet dhe praktikat jashtë programit mësimor dhe garat e tjera janë anulura.
Shkollat do të jenë të hapura vetëm për stafin.
Të gjitha objektet e Qarkut, përfshijnë pishinën, janë të mbyllura për grupe të mbrendshme dhe të jashtme.
6-12: Mësimet virtuale fillojnë të Enjtën, 19 Mars. Shiqoni për më tepër komunikime nga drejtoria e shkollës tuaj për mësimet virtuale.

K-5: Mësimi virtual fillon pas pushimit të pranverës të Hënën, 30 Mars. Në nivelet e klasave nga K-5 mësueset do të kontaktojnë familjet nëse kanë materiale të veqanta të klasës që ata mund të vijnë ti marrin të Martën/të Mërkurën gjatë kohës së marrjes. Shiqoni për më tepër komunikime nga drejtoria e shkollës tuaj për mësimet virtuale.

ul.li: Video conferencing opt-out (Albanian)
Family virtual learning feedback (English)

div.p: 21 Prill, 2020: Nё urdhёrat mё tё rejat nga Guvernatori Evers’ pёr Mё tё Sigurt nё Shtёpi ose “Safer at Home”, ne nuk do tё mbajmё regjistrimin pёr programin “Summer Excel” tё Hёnёn, 27 Prill. Ju lutemi shёnoni kjo ёshtё njё ndyshim nga lajmёrimet e programit “Summer Excel nga e Premtja nё Gazetёn “E-news” dhe mё herёt sod nё Mesazhin e tё Hёnёs.

Ne aktualisht po shqyrtojmё njё shumёllojshmёri tё mundёsive pёr programin tonё “Summer Excel” 2020. Mё tё rejat do tё jenё nё gazetёn e familjes “E-News” dhe mesazhet kur ti kemi ato. Ne do tё vazhdojmё tё ju njoftojmё sa mё shpejtё qё ёshtё e mundur kur tё mirret njё vendim.
Faleminderit pёr durimin tuaj deri sa ne punojmё tё vendosim mundёsinё mё tё sigurt dhe mё tё mirё pёr studentёt tanё.
.1. A ju duhet lidhja e internetit?
2. A ju duhet një kompjuter "chromebook?"
Nëse po kontaktoni (608)513-8392.

h3.strong: Nga 17 Prill deri sa të bëhet hapja përsëri e shkollës.

div.p: Në Lidhje me: Ushqimin Ditor të Studentëve

Aktualisht qarku po afron ushqime qdo ditë në katër vende në bazë të formularit që e plotësoni. Në mënyrë që më mirë të mbështesim kërkesën që të rrimë në shtëpi ne do të kalojmë në dërgimin nga dera në derë të ushqimit duke filluar nga 17 Prilli, 2020 dhe do të ofrojmë ushqime edhe gjatë vikendit deri sa të fillojnë shkollat.

Familjet që momentalisht marrin ushqimet automatikisht do të ndrrohen në procesin e ri më poshtë duke filluar nga 17 Prilli. Qarku do ti kontaktoj familjet që tash më janë në listën e regjistrimit gjatë javës së 13 Prillit të konfirmojmë shqyrtimin e procesit të ri.

Familjet që nuk janë të regjistruara por dëshirojnë të regjistrohen mund ta bëjnë atë duke hyrë këtu ose “clicking here.” Ju lutemi shënoni: FORMULAR I VEQANT nevoitet për secilin fëmijë të sigurohemi që kemi ushqim të mjaftueshëm gjatë numërimit tonë. Ju do të merrni një telefonatë konfirmuese pasi të regjistroheni të shqyrtojmë protokolin për dërgimin e ushqimit. Nëse ju nuk merrni një telefonatë mbrenda 24 orëve, ju lutemi kontaktoni Jenny McKenna në jenny.mckenna@Stoughton.k12.wi.us ose më leni një mesash në 608.877.5012.

h4.strong: Procesi i Ushqimit nga Dera në Derë

li.p: Ushqimi do të sjellet të Hënëve, të Mërkureve dhe të Premteve nga ora 11am dhe 12pm. Secila familje do të marrë një telefonatë nga qarku me shqyrtmiet e protokolit.
Të Hënën ushqimi do të përfshijë: drekën për të Hënën, mëngjesin dhe drekën për të Martën dhe mëngjesin për të Mërkurën.
Të Mërkurën ushqimi do të përfshijë: drekën për të Mërkurën, mëngjesin dhe drekën për të Enjtën dhe mëngjesin për të Premtën.
Të Mërkurën ushqimi do të përfshinë: drekën për të Premtën, mëngjesin dhe drekën për të Shtunën, mëngjesin dhe drekën për të Dielën dhe mëngjesin për të Hënën.

div.p: Nëse keni ndonjë pyetje ose shqetësim ju lutemi kontaktoni Jenny Mckenna në jenny.mckenna@Stoughton.k12.wi.us.

div.class: fsDiv fsStyleOneThird fsStyleColumn fsStyleColumn-2 fsStyleColumn-last fsStyleAutoclear

li.a: Recursos y links sobre el coronavirus (Español y inglés)

div.p: El jueves, 16 de abril, La Secretaria del Departamento de Servicios de Salud de Wisconsin, Andrea Palm, bajo la dirección del gobernador Evers, ordenó el cierre de todas las escuelas públicas y privadas de K-12 para el resto del año escolar 2019-2020. Este anuncio también extendió el orden más amplia de Más Seguro en el Hogar hasta el 26 de mayo.

En ese momento, continuaremos con el aprendizaje virtual con nuestros estudiantes 4K-12 para el resto del año escolar. Por favor, presten atención a su correo electrónico para obtener actualizaciones y orientación sobre el aprendizaje virtual.
Durante el tiempo del cierre escolar (16 de marzo --), las siguientes condiciones aplican:

ul.li: Todos los eventos patrocinados por el distrito (conciertos, presentaciones, conferencias, excursiones, etc.) están cancelados.
Todos los deportes y otras prácticas y competiciones extracurriculares están cancelados.
Los edificios escolares estarán abiertos solo para algunos miembros del staff del distrito.
Todas las instalaciones del distrito, incluyendo la piscina, están cerradas para uso de grupos internos o externos.

div.p: Todos los eventos afuera de Wisconsin y Estados Unidos están cancelados del 3 de abril al 31 de julio.

li.p: Grados 6-12: El aprendizaje virtual comienza el jueves, 19 de marzo. Busquen comunicaciones futuras del director de la escuela sobre el aprendizaje virtual.

ul.li: K-5: El aprendizaje virtual comienza después de las vacaciones de primavera el lunes, 30 de marzo. En los niveles de K-5, los maestros contactarán a las familias si hay materiales específicas de las clase para recoger durante las horas de recogida el martes/miércoles. Busque comunicación futura del director de la escuela sobre el aprendizaje virtual.
Video conferencing opt-out (español)
El Aprendizaje Virtual: Cuestionario familiar (español)

div.p: El 17 de abril

Junto con todos ustedes y nuestra comunidad SASD, tenemos muchas esperanzas de poder seguir con la programación para Summer Excel (clases del verano). Ahora más que nunca, nuestros estudiantes estarán ansiosos por las oportunidades de conexión, curiosidad y alegría que ofrece Summer Excel. Gracias por su paciencia mientras esperamos cualquier información que pueda ayudarnos a tomar nuestra decisión. Si podemos ofrecer Summer Excel con seguridad, lo haremos.

En este momento, estamos programados para comenzar con registración el 27 de abril, que es dos semanas después de nuestra fecha de registración original del 13 de abril. Si recibimos información que afecte esta decisión, o la programación de Summer Excel de alguna manera, informaremos a todo el personal y las familias lo antes posible.

Lo major que podamos, proporcionaremos asistencia tecnológica (punto de acceso al WiFi hotspots y Chromebooks) a las familias. Si su familia necesita una conexión a internet, o si necesita una computadora “Chromebook” para sus hijos, por favor envíe un correo electrónico a deena.ferguson@stoughton.k12.wi.us.

Las escuelas de Stoughton están cerradas pero van a proporcionar a las familias la oportunidad para registrarse para comidas nutritivas gratuitas para todos los niños de 18 años y menores y estudiantes de 19 a 21 años que aún no se han graduado.

Actualmente, el distrito ofrece la recogida de comida diaria en cuatro lugares a través de un formulario de registro. En un esfuerzo por servir mejor a nuestros estudiantes y apoyar el orden Safer at Home (Orden de Emergencia Más Seguro en el Hogar), nos cambiaremos a la entrega puerta a puerta comenzando el 17 de abril, 2020 y proporcionaremos comidas para el fin de semana hasta que se reanude la escuela.
div.h3: La entrega puerta a puerta, comenzando el 17 de abril, 2020
div.p: Las familias que ya recogen las comidas serán trasladadas automáticamente al nuevo proceso a partir del 17 de abril. El distrito llamará a las familias que ya están en nuestra lista de registración comenzando en la semana del 13 de abril para confirmar y repasar el nuevo proceso.

Para las familias no registradas pero quién quisiera registrarse pueden hacer clic aquí. Tenga en cuenta que necesita un FORMULARIO SEPARADO para cada niño para especificar que cada comida está incluida en nuestro cuento diario. Recibirá una llamada telefónica de confirmación después de presentar el formulario para revisar el proceso de entrega. Si no recibe una llamada dentro de las 24 horas, comuníquese con Jenny McKenna en jenny.mckenna@Stoughton.k12.wi.us.
div.h4: Proceso de entrega puerta a puerta

li.p: Las entregas serán los lunes, miércoles, y viernes entre las 11 a.m. y las 12 p.m. Cada hogar recibirá una llamada del distrito con un repaso del proceso.

ul.li: La entrega del lunes incluirá: el almuerzo para lunes, el desayuno y almuerzo para el martes, y el desayuno para el miércoles.
La entrega del miércoles incluirá: el almuerzo para el miércoles, el desayuno y almuerzo para el jueves, y el desayuno para el viernes.
La entrega del viernes incluirá: el almuerzo para viernes, el desayuno y almuerzo para el sábado, el desayuno y almuerzo para el domingo, y el desayuno para el lunes.

div.p: Para otras preguntas sobre la recogida de comidas: por favor, contacte a Jenny McKenna en (608)877-5012, o para ayuda en español, Deena Ferguson en (608) 235-2847.
